locations.name: San Agustin Church
locations.address: Gen. Luna St, Intramuros, Manila, 1002 Metro Manila, Philippines
locations.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site and the oldest stone church in the Philippines, built in 1607. Known for its Baroque architecture and historical significance during the Spanish colonial period.

locations.name: The Ruins
locations.description: Remnants of a 1920s Italianate mansion built by Don Mariano Ledesma Lacson. Often called the 'Taj Mahal of the Philippines' and beautifully lit at night.

locations.name: Fort Santiago
locations.description: A historic Spanish citadel built in 1571. It served as a defense fortress and prison, including for national hero José Rizal before his execution.

locations.name: Taoist Temple
locations.address: Beverly Hills Subdivision, Cebu City, 6000 Cebu, Philippines
locations.description: Built in 1972 by Cebu's Chinese community, this temple features traditional Chinese architecture and offers panoramic views of the city.

locations.name: Baclayon Church
locations.description: One of the oldest churches in the Philippines, dating back to the early 1700s. Built using coral stones, it showcases Spanish Colonial architecture.

locations.name: Ilocos Norte Capitol Building
locations.description: A neoclassical government building constructed during the American period. It’s a symbol of Ilocos Norte’s political and cultural history.

locations.name: Malacañang Palace Museum
locations.address: JP Laurel Street, San Miguel, Manila, Philippines
locations.description: The official residence of the President of the Philippines. Kalayaan Hall now houses a museum showcasing presidential memorabilia and Philippine history.

locations.name: Casa Manila
locations.address: Plaza San Luis Complex, Intramuros, Manila, 1002 Metro Manila, Philippines
locations.description: A restored Spanish colonial house-turned-museum that illustrates upper-class Filipino life during the 19th century.
